item.title: Projects
item.description: Homelab (2022-present) This ongoing project is an elaborate home server that involves a wide range of areas, including virtualization, containerization, network security, and system administration. Throughout its process, I've been conceptualizing, developing, and managing a comprehensive environment that integrates technologies such as QEMU/KVM, Debian, and Docker. As I delve into it, I'm continuously deploying and testing a variety of tools and services, enabling me to create a highly optimized system for my specific needs.
item.content:
Homelab (2022-present)

This ongoing project is an elaborate home server that involves a wide range of areas, including virtualization, containerization, network security, and system administration. Throughout its process, I've been conceptualizing, developing, and managing a comprehensive environment that integrates technologies such as QEMU/KVM, Debian, and Docker. As I delve into it, I'm continuously deploying and testing a variety of tools and services, enabling me to create a highly optimized system for my specific needs.

  • System

    • QEMU/KVM
    • Debian Bullseye
    • Docker

  • Network

    • Nginx Reverse Proxy
    • Unbound DNS
    • UFW
    • Pihole
    • VPN
    • SSH

  • Services

    • Home Assistant
    • Jellyfin
    • Hugo

  • Management

    • Portainer
    • Grafana
    • Prometheus
    • Node Exporter
    • cAdvisor
    • Gotify
    • Watchtower

AWS Cloud (2018-2022)

This project involved deploying dynamic websites on AWS, managing network, DNS, snapshots, and system updates on Ubuntu Server instances. To accomplish this, I employed a combination of AWS resources, such as Route 53 and Lightsail, along with remote and security tools. During its operation, I also handled other tasks including WordPress management, content creation, and website design and customization.

  • Ubuntu Server
  • Route 53
  • Lightsail
  • CloudWatch
  • Bitnami
  • Wordpress Multisite

item.title: Hello, w̶o̶r̶l̶d̶!
item.description: I'm Vinicius Moraes and this is my personal corner on the internet. Here you can follow my productions and read about the most varied topics. Blog indexation: Categories Broadcasts — playlists, podcasts, videos and other non-text formats. Essays — texts that deepen themes of interest. Notes — notes, comments, interpretations. Topics Autobiography — personal productions. Cinema — cinematic art and movies. Computing — programming, GNU Linux, Emacs, self-hosting. Reading — books, poems, short stories, articles.
item.content:
I'm Vinicius Moraes and this is my personal corner on the internet. Here you can follow my productions and read about the most varied topics.

Blog indexation:

  • Categories

    • Broadcasts — playlists, podcasts, videos and other non-text formats.
    • Essays — texts that deepen themes of interest.
    • Notes — notes, comments, interpretations.

  • Topics

    • Autobiography — personal productions.
    • Cinema — cinematic art and movies.
    • Computing — programming, GNU Linux, Emacs, self-hosting.
    • Reading — books, poems, short stories, articles.
    • Translation — translation art and translations.
    • Music — playlists and songs.

If you have any questions or want to engage in conversation, feel free to contact me via email.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Article Metamorfoses: a transformação dos mitos e o ato de (re)contar histórias. Rónai – Revista de Estudos Clássicos e Tradutórios, vol. 4, no. 2, 2016, pp. 71-78. Monograph O abismo do original: a bitradução simultânea de Malone Morre, de Samuel Beckett, por Paulo Leminski. Trabalho de Conclusão de Curso, UFJF, Juiz de Fora, 2021. Work Ekphrasis and Other Forms of Text-Image Relations: Open City by Teju Cole. Presentation, Universität Passau, Passau, 2018.
item.content:
Article

  • Metamorfoses: a transformação dos mitos e o ato de (re)contar histórias. Rónai – Revista de Estudos Clássicos e Tradutórios, vol. 4, no. 2, 2016, pp. 71-78.

Monograph

  • O abismo do original: a bitradução simultânea de Malone Morre, de Samuel Beckett, por Paulo Leminski. Trabalho de Conclusão de Curso, UFJF, Juiz de Fora, 2021.

Work

  • Ekphrasis and Other Forms of Text-Image Relations: Open City by Teju Cole. Presentation, Universität Passau, Passau, 2018.
  • Aspectos intertextuais nas canções de Bob Dylan: Tristia e Epistulae Ex Ponto de Ovídio. Pôster, XXI Congresso da SBEC, São Paulo, 2017.
  • O abismo do original: a bitradução simultânea de Malone Morre, de Samuel Beckett, por Paulo Leminski. Pré-projeto TCC, UFJF, Juiz de Fora, 2017.
  • Madrugada em Claro: gêneros textuais. Trabalho Acadêmico, UFJF, Juiz de Fora, 2017.

Translation

  • Emacs. Slackware Linux Project, Sebeka, dez. 2022.
  • O inconsciente intertextual, Michael Riffaterre. Revista Ipotesi, v.25, n.1, Juiz de Fora, jan./jun. 2021.
  • Se não pararmos agora, outra Hiroshima se aproxima, John Pilger. Revista Opera, São Paulo, ago. 2020.
  • Por uma Coreia pacífica e unida, George Burchett. Revista Opera, São Paulo, ago. 2019.
  • EUA-Brasil: defesa, segurança e subordinação, Tamara Lajtman. Revista Opera, São Paulo, jul. 2019.
  • Rússia-China: a cúpula que a mídia ignorou, Manlio Dinucci. Revista Opera, São Paulo, jun. 2019.
  • EUA e a disputa pela infraestrutura na América Latina, Silvina Romano e Aníbal García Fernández. Revista Opera, São Paulo, jun. 2019.
  • A Propagação Hegemônica: como as agências globais e a mídia ocidental cobrem a geopolítica, Swiss Propaganda Research. Revista Opera, São Paulo, abr. 2019.
  • Socialismo sob ataque da amedrontada Casa Branca, Ian Goodrum. Revista Opera, São Paulo, abr. 2019.

item.title: About
item.description: I'm a Bachelor of Arts graduate from the Federal University of Juiz de Fora, where I majored in Portuguese and Translation. For my undergraduate thesis, "The Abyss of the Original", I addressed Leminski's simultaneous bitranslation of Beckett's "Malone Dies" and "Malone Meurt". Within my academic program, I pursued topics in Classical Studies, Semiotics, Translation Theory, Computational Linguistics, and a range of other subjects. But don't let my fall for the Babel Tower fool you, when I'm not lost in the world of language, I'm probably diving deep in some other world—overall the worlds of cinema, philosophy, and technology.
item.content:
I'm a Bachelor of Arts graduate from the Federal University of Juiz de Fora, where I majored in Portuguese and Translation. For my undergraduate thesis, "The Abyss of the Original", I addressed Leminski's simultaneous bitranslation of Beckett's "Malone Dies" and "Malone Meurt". Within my academic program, I pursued topics in Classical Studies, Semiotics, Translation Theory, Computational Linguistics, and a range of other subjects.

But don't let my fall for the Babel Tower fool you, when I'm not lost in the world of language, I'm probably diving deep in some other world—overall the worlds of cinema, philosophy, and technology. Lately, I've been immersing myself in the realm of GNU Linux and Emacs, exploring the power of free software and self-hosting, and tinkering with different programming languages like Bash, Python, Elisp, and C to extend what I can do.

During my college days, I spent a year abroad at the University of Passau in Germany, where I attended Sprach- und Textwissenschaften and advanced my studies on Ekphrasis and Text-Image Relations. It was an incredible experience and really broadened my horizons in every sense—just as the breathtaking view of compound words longer than the Autobahn.

Since 2018, I've been maintaining this website to gather my interests and creations. And as eterno devir tells… there will always be more to come.

item.content:
• Email: vinicius.moraes@eternodevir.com

Feel free to email me regarding any content on this website, whether you've got a suggestion, some feedback, or just want to engage about a shared interest. Typically I respond within a week at most, often much sooner. If you haven't heard back from me after that, please check your spam folder, as my response may have been filtered there.

Key valid from 2023-04-01 to 2025-03-31. Any older key should be discarded.

I recommend learning about encryption to communicate with your trusted contacts in a more secure and reliable way. By using PGP, you can be confident that the email content is confidential, authentic, and hasn't been tampered with during transmission. Even if you aren't a tech expert, PGP implementation isn't difficult. You can get started with this excellent guide by the Free Software Foundation.
